src:
Sisi Romantis Pacitan ada di Sini
03 Nov 2019, 08:30 by Purwo Sumodiharjo


Foto: (Purwo Sumodiharjo/detikcom)

Pacitan - Akhir pekan di Pacitan rasanya kurang lengkap tanpa foto-foto instagrammable. Main ke Beiji Park kamu bisa melihat sisi Pacitan yang romantis.Kabupaten Pacitan dikenal dengan puluhan obyek wisata alamnya. Mulai pantai hingga gua, semuanya ada. Belum lagi upacara adat maupun aneka kuliner khas. Kian melengkapi khazanah wisata daerah berjuluk Kota 1001 Gua.Nah, di antara kekayaan alam yang ada, Pacitan juga dikarunia hutan dengan panorama memukau, namanya Beiji Park. Obyek wisata yang dulunya bernama hutan 'Pacitan Indah' ini berada di tepi jalur utama Pacitan-Solo.Hanya butuh 15 menit berkendara ke arah barat dari ibu kota Pacitan menuju lokasi. Jarak tempuh sejauh 10 kilometer itu pun terasa begitu dekat. Jalanan beraspal mulus, namun kendaraan tak bisa melaju kencang. Sebab, rute yang melintasi hutan rakyat itu didominasi tikungan dan kelokan.Tak sulit menemukan lokasi obyek wisata hutan tersebut, letaknya persis di samping kanan jalan raya. Tepatnya di wilayah Desa Dadapan, Kecamatan Pringkuku. Papan besar bertuliskan 'Wisata Alam Beiji Park' menjadi penanda wisatawan sampai di tujuan.


Foto: (Purwo Sumodiharjo/detikcom)

Area parkir yang tersedia di depan pintu masuk pun tergolong luas. Saat akhir pekan maupun liburan, puluhan kendaraan tampak memadati pelataran parkir. Tak hanya kendaraan pribadi, banyak moda angkutan penumpang berupa bus yang membawa wisatawan ke tempat itu."Selau ramai (pengunjung) terutama saat akhir pekan dan liburan," ujar seorang petugas loket berbaju oranye kepada detikcom, Sabtu (2/11/2019) siang.Untuk masuk ke kawasan itu, pengunjung hanya perlu merogoh kocek Rp 10 ribu. Namun jika ingin menikmati beberapa jenis wahana di dalamnya, mesti disiapkan sedikit tambahan dana. Semisal untuk menjajal wahana sepeda gantung, ongkos per kepala sebesar Rp 15 ribu.Di samping itu masih ada beberapa wahana lain yang dapat membangkitkan andrenaline. Salah satunya ajang flying fox. Sedangkan bagi yang hobi swafoto, Beiji Park juga menjadi menyuguhkan beberapa spot selfie.


Foto: (Purwo Sumodiharjo/detikcom)

Jembatan kayu yang melengkung di atas ngarai menjadi pilihan pertama untuk mengabadikan momen tersebut. Komposisinya pun tampak makin sempurna dengan payung warna-warni. Ornamen itu bergelantungan di antara rindang pohon mahoni.Berikutnya, hanya dengan sedikit berjalan menanjak menuju puncak bukit, wisatawan akan mendapati satu lagi spot selfie paling favorit. Panggung besar berbahan kayu dengan bentuk moncong perahu, menjorok ke atas jurang vertikal.


Foto: (Purwo Sumodiharjo/detikcom)

Sedangkan latar belakangnya adalah lanskap Kota Pacitan. Barisan pegunungan di sisi utara serta hamparan Samudera Indonesia di ujung selatan menggambarkan perpaduan kawasan agraris sekaligus maritim. Sementara nuansa dinamis terwakili pemukiman padat di tengahnya."Saya orangnya takut ketinggian. Tapi udah sampai sini, sayang kalau nggak selfie," ucap Adi (17) usai berswafoto bersama ibu dan adik perempuannya. Simak Video "Gemas! Sampah Menumpuk di Sungai Grindulu Pacitan"[Gambas:Video 20detik](bnl/bnl)
text:
The romantic side of Pacitan is here
03 Nov 2019, 08:30 by Purwo Sumodiharjo


Photo: (Purwo Sumodiharjo / detikcom)

Pacitan - A weekend in Pacitan feels incomplete without instagrammable photos. Main to Beiji Park, you can see the romantic side of Pacitan. Pacitan Regency is known for its dozens of natural attractions. From the beach to the cave, everything is there. Not to mention traditional ceremonies and various culinary specialties. Increasingly complement the regional treasures nicknamed the City 1001 Cave. Well, among the natural wealth that exists, Pacitan is also blessed with forests with stunning panoramas, named Beiji Park. This tourist attraction, formerly called the 'Pacitan Indah' forest, is located on the edge of the Pacitan-Sol main line. It only takes 15 minutes to drive west from the capital city of Pacitan to the location. The distance of 10 kilometers feels so close. The asphalt road is smooth, but the vehicle cannot go fast. Because, the route that crosses the community forest is dominated by bends and bends. It is not difficult to find the location of the forest tourism object, it is located right on the right side of the highway. Precisely in the area of Dadapan Village, Pringkuku District. The big sign that reads 'Beiji Park Nature Tourism' is a sign of tourists arriving at their destination.


Photo: (Purwo Sumodiharjo / detikcom)

Parking area available in front of the entrance was quite broad. During weekends and holidays, dozens of vehicles appear to throng the parking lot. Not only private vehicles, many modes of passenger transportation in the form of buses that bring tourists to the place. "Always crowded (visitors), especially during weekends and holidays," said a ticket counter clerk in orange told AFP on Saturday (2/11/2019) afternoon To enter the area, visitors only need to spend Rp 10 thousand. But if you want to enjoy some type of vehicle in it, you should prepare a little extra funding. For example, to try a bicycle ride, the cost per head is Rp. 15 thousand. Besides that, there are still some other vehicles that can generate andrenaline. One of them is the flying fox. As for those who like selfies, Beiji Park also presents a number of selfie spots.


Photo: (Purwo Sumodiharjo / detikcom)

Curved wooden bridge over the canyon is the first choice to capture the moment. Its composition also looks even more perfect with colorful umbrellas. The ornaments hang among the shade of mahogany trees. Next, with just a little walk uphill to the top of the hill, tourists will find one more favorite selfie spot. A large wooden platform with a snout in the shape of a boat, protruding over a vertical ravine.


Photo: (Purwo Sumodiharjo / detikcom)

While the background is the landscape of Pacitan City. The mountain range on the north side and the expanse of the Indonesian Ocean at the southern end illustrates the fusion of an agricultural and maritime area. While dynamic nuances are represented by dense settlements in the center. "I am afraid of heights. But I have arrived here, it's a shame if I don't take a selfie," said Adi (17) after taking a photo with his mother and younger sister. Check out the video "Anxious! Garbage Piling up in the Grindulu River Pacitan" [Gambas: Video 20second] (bnl / bnl)
